class.name: Evip
class.description: Top class for EVIP Configuration

attribute.name: evipId
attribute.description: The version of Evip config

class.name: EvipAlbs
class.description: Container class for Abstract Load Balancers (ALBs).

attribute.name: evipAlbsId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Always "1".

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: DEPRECATED An array of commands that are executed on all ALBs when they are activated. The commands are referred by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher. The commands are executed on all LBEs, FEEs and payload nodes in all ALBs.

class.name: EvipCommandDefinition
class.description: Container class for all command definitions.

attribute.name: evipCommandDefinitionId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Always "1".

class.name: EvipDeclarations
class.description: Container class for generic EVIP declarations.

attribute.name: evipDeclarationsId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Always "1".

class.name: EvipCommand
class.description: Defines a command to be used as a startup command. Startup commands may be defined at many places in the EVIP configuration. The actual shell command is defined here and is referred by its identity from other places.

attribute.name: evipCommandId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. This identity is used as reference at other places in the EVIP configuration when the command is used.

attribute.name: command
attribute.description: This is the shell command to execute.

class.name: EvipCluster
class.description: Describes the cluster where EVIP is running.

attribute.name: evipClusterId
attribute.description: RDN Attribute. Always "1".

attribute.name: primaryInterface
attribute.description: Names the interface to use for EVIP traffic. This interface should be redundant in some way for instance with bonding.

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed on all nodes when EVIP starts. The commands are referred by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher.

attribute.name: macvlanLinkLocalRangeStart
attribute.description: The MAC addresses are generated at random. For large clusters the probability for collisions becomes too high. Instead a range is used with this base address plus the node-id.

attribute.name: commandsForAllUndesignated
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed on all undesignated nodes when EVIP starts. The commands are referred by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher.

class.name: EvipNode
class.description: Describes the logical EvipNode and how it is allocated to a processing unit (blade/VM) in the cluster.

attribute.name: evipNodeId
attribute.description: This is the RDN attribute. The node identities must be a consecutive integer value for all nodes. This identity is used to define node ranges, for instance "3-9" at other places in the EVIP configuration.

attribute.name: hostname
attribute.description: This is the hostname of the processing unit (blade/VM) in the cluster where the EvipNode shall be located. It is just the simple hostname printed when the "hostname" command is executed, not the fully qualified domain name. The attribute is only valid if distribution is set to FIXED.

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed on this node when EVIP starts. The commands are refered by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceeded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher. The commands defined here are executed after any commands defined on cluster level.

attribute.name: primaryInterface
attribute.description: Obsolete (Not used any more) Names the interface to use for EVIP traffic. This interface should be redundant in some way for instance with bonding. This should only be specified if the interface name on this particular node differs from the one specified on cluster level.

attribute.name: distribution
attribute.description: Floating behavior of the EvipNode can be selected by setting distribution to FLOATING. This means that the EvipNode automatically is allocated, and reallocated if needed, to any vacant processing unit in the cluster. If this parameter is set to FIXED (default) the EvipNode will be allocated to a specific processing unit identified by Hostname.

attribute.name: floatPriority
attribute.description: This attribute is used to prioritize which EvipNodes to keep running in the case where fewer vacant processing units than the number of floating EvipNodes are available in the cluster. Higher value equals higher priority and the use of decimal numbers (floating point) is allowed. The attribute is only valid if distribution is set to FLOATING.

class.name: EvipParam
class.description: Defines a generic parameter. This class is used on many places for defining various parameters.

attribute.name: evipParamId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. This is the parameter name or "key".

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The parameter value.

class.name: EvipTargetPools
class.description: Container class for Target Pools.

attribute.name: evipTargetPoolsId
attribute.description: RDN attribute. Always "1".

class.name: EvipTargetPool
class.description: Defines a Target Pool.

attribute.name: evipTargetPoolId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. This is a unique name within the ALB. This name is used in Flow Policies that selects traffic to this Target Pool.

attribute.name: distributionMethod
attribute.description:
The distribution method. Supported values are; "round_robin" "weighted_round_robin" "least_connection" "weighted_least_connection" "locality_based_least_connection" "locality_based_least_connection_with_replication" "destination_hash" "source_hash" "shortest_expected_delay" "never_queue"
OBSOLETE values: "strict_round_robin" "strict_weighted_round_robin" "strict_least_connection" "strict_weighted_least_connection" "strict_shortest_expected_delay" "strict_never_queue"

attribute.name: stickyGroup
attribute.description: Stickiness means that all network traffic form one remote host is distributed to the same node. This may for instance be necessary to hold together a HTTP session consisting of multiple connections. Stickiness could however cause poor distribution if you have a dominant source and is to be avoided if possible.

attribute.name: stickinessTimeout
attribute.description: Decides the time in seconds a connection shall be persistent.

attribute.name: udpStateless
attribute.description: Decides if UDP traffic should be semi-persistant or totaly stateless. Should be used if "packet-sprayer" is needed for UDP.

attribute.name: allUndesignated
attribute.description: True if any undesignated node will belong to this target pool. Used for cloud floating node configuration.

class.name: EvipPayload
class.description: Defines a payload node in a Target Pool.

attribute.name: evipPayloadId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. This specifies the node-id or a node-id range.

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed on this node when EVIP starts. The commands are referred by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher.

attribute.name: weight
attribute.description: For weighted distribution methods this is an integer value defining the "weight" of the payload node. Id the distribution method is non-weighted this attribute is ignored.

class.name: EvipParams
class.description: Container class for generic EVIP parameters.

attribute.name: evipParamsId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Always "1".

class.name: EvipAlb
class.description: Defines an Abstract Load Balancer (ALB).

action.name: activate
action.description: Activates the ALB. The activation may fail if the ALB configuration is invalid. The current state can be examined in the "state" attribute.

action.name: reloadike
action.description: Send reload command to the IKE agent.

attribute.name: evipAlbId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Must be a unique name selected by the operator.

attribute.name: serviceIp
attribute.description: This is an IPv6 address for internal use in eVIP (one per ALB). The eVIP system administrator must make sure this IP does not collide with anything else in the system. If this value is not provided then eVIP uses an internally calculated value.

attribute.name: numKeys
attribute.description: Number of units (keys) used for connection distribution. Must be a power of 2. This value should be several times higher than the number of LBEs but a too high value will slow down reconfiguration on an LBE failure. The default is 256 and will do nicely for most cases.

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: Deprecated. An array of commands that are executed when the ALB is activated. The commands are referred by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher. The commands are executed on all LBEs, FEEs in the ALB.

attribute.name: state
attribute.description: This is the state of the ALB. The state can be "ACTIVE" or "INACTIVE".

attribute.name: numIpsecKeys
attribute.description: Number of units (keys) used for SE connection distribution. Must be a power of 2. This value should be several times higher than the number of SEs but a too high value will slow down reconfiguration on an SE failure. The default is 256 and will do nicely for most cases.

attribute.name: ipsecServiceIp
attribute.description: This is an IPv6 address for internal use in eVIP (one per ALB). The eVIP system administrator must make sure this IP does not collide with anything else in the system. If this value is not provided then eVIP uses an internally calculated value.

attribute.name: lbeHash
udpEncapsulationPort
attribute.description: Optional port number used for UDP encapsulation of IPsec packets, aka NAT traversal. If the value is 0 or the attribute is omitted, NAT-T is disabled. Recommended value is 4500 if not 0.

attribute.name: ipvsTcpfinTimeout
attribute.description:
This timeout value (in seconds) is used for IPVS connections, for TCP sessions after receiving a FIN packet. The default value is 120.
For more information see manual page of IPVS (IP Virtual Server).

attribute.name: ipvsTcpTimeout
attribute.description:
This timeout value (in seconds) is used for IPVS connections, for TCP sessions in ESTABLISHED state. The default value is 9000.
For more information see manual page of IPVS (IP Virtual Server).

attribute.name: ipvsUdpTimeout
attribute.description:
This timeout value (in seconds) is used for IPVS connections, for UDP packets. The default value is 120.
For more information see manual page of IPVS (IP Virtual Server).

attribute.name: private
attribute.description: Private ALB contains IP configuration that may overlap with other ALBs. Default value is "no".

class.name: EvipErsipParams
class.description: Container for the ALB specific RSIP parameters.

attribute.name: evipErsipParamsId
attribute.description: RDN attribute. Always "1".

class.name: EvipLbes
class.description: Container class for Load Balancing Elements (LBEs)

attribute.name: evipLbesId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Always "1".

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed on all LBEs when the containing ALB is activated. The commands are refered by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceeded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher.

class.name: EvipFees
class.description: Container class for Front End Elements (FEEs).

attribute.name: evipFeesId
attribute.description: The RDN Attribute. Always "1".

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed on all FEEs when the containing ALB is activated. The commands are referred by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher.

class.name: EvipVips
class.description: Container class for Virtual IP addresses (VIPs).

attribute.name: evipVipsId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Always "1".

class.name: EvipFlowPolicies
class.description: Container Class for Flow Policies.

attribute.name: evipFlowPoliciesId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Always "1".

class.name: EvipLbe
class.description: Defines a Load Balancing Element (LBE).

attribute.name: evipLbeId
attribute.description: RDN attribute. A unique name within the ALB.

attribute.name: node
attribute.description: The node-id of the node where the LBE is executing.

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed on the LBE the containing ALB is activated. The commands are refered by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceeded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher.

class.name: EvipFee
class.description: Defines a Front End Element (FEE).

action.name: inactivate
action.description: Deprecated. Inactivates the FEE. The FEE must be inactive when routing parameters are updated. The current state can be examined in the "state" attribute.

action.name: activate
action.description: Deprecated. Activates the FEE. The FEE must be activated after the routing parameters have been updated. The current state can be examined in the "state" attribute.

attribute.name: evipFeeId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. A unique name within the ALB.

attribute.name: node
attribute.description: The node-id of the node where the FEE is executing.

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed on the FEE when the containing ALB is activated. The commands are referred by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher.

attribute.name: state
attribute.description: The state of the FEE. May be ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

attribute.name: externalInterface
attribute.description: The name of the interface to the external DCN. The interfaces may have a appended VLAN tag, for instance "eth3.4711".

attribute.name: extIfBridging
attribute.description: Default true. Indicate if a bridged interface shall be used in the FEE. If set to false the nic-interface (e.g. "eth1") will be moved into the FEE container and will become invisible in the main name space. This attribute shall be set to false when bridging external interfaces is not allowed, e.g. some cloud environments.

class.name: EvipRoutingSetup
class.description: Contains routing setup parameter for a specific routing protocol.

attribute.name: evipRoutingSetupId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. This attribute specifies the routing protocol. The supported protocols are; "ospfv2" "bfd_ospfv2" "ospfv3" "bfd_ospfv3" "bfd_static" "bfd_static6" For the specific routing parameters please see the "EVIP Management Guide"

class.name: EvipSupervisedRemoteGateway
class.description: Defines an external gateway to supervise. This gateway may for instance be a router essential for EVIP traffic. If EVIP loses contact with the gateway an alarm is raised.

attribute.name: evipSupervisedRemoteGatewayId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. This is the IP-address of the supervised gateway.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: This is an optional description defined by the operator. The purpose of this attribute is to simplify the procedure when an alarm is raised for this gateway. The operator receiving the alarm for this gateway should open this object and read the description attribute for more information about the gateway. This attribute can for instance contain the location or identiry of the gateway, or a local contact person or any other useful information.

class.name: EvipVip
class.description: Defines a Virtual IP address (VIP)

action.name: activate
action.description: Activates the VIP. The current state can be examined in the "state" attribute.

attribute.name: evipVipId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. This the IP address.

attribute.name: deflt
attribute.description: OBSOLETE (value ignored) Identifies the default VIP. Only one VIP in the containing ALB must have this attribute set to "true"

attribute.name: equivSrcAddr
attribute.description: True if this address can be used for alias feature.

attribute.name: autoActivate
attribute.description: True if the vip shall be announced (activated) at startup and creation.

attribute.name: state
attribute.description: This is the state of the VIP. The state can be "ACTIVE" or "INACTIVE".

class.name: EvipFlowPolicy
class.description: Defines a Flow Policy. Incoming traffic selected by this Flow Policy must match all defined attributes (logical AND).

attribute.name: evipFlowPolicyId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. A unique name within the ALB.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: Defines the protocol for the Flow Policy: Supported values are; "tcp" "udp" "sctp" "other" "all"

attribute.name: targetPool
attribute.description: The name of the Target Pool within the containing ALB that receives traffic selected by this Flow Policy. soGrp and targetPool are mutually exclusive.

attribute.name: destPort
attribute.description: Incoming traffic with this (local) destination port is selected by this Flow Policy. Only 15 distinct ports or port ranges can map to one sticky target pool. This is due to a hard limit in iptables. Flow policies that specify ports that are in a range are converted to a range. For example if there are three flow policies for destPort 80, 81 and 82 (otherwise identical and mapped to the same sticky target pool) these policies will be converted to one range 80-82. 15 such ranges (or individual ports) on one sticky target pool is the maximum.

attribute.name: src
attribute.description: Incoming traffic with this source (remote) network address is selected by this Flow Policy.

attribute.name: addressFamily
attribute.description: Incoming traffic with this address family is selected by this Flow Policy.

attribute.name: srcPort
attribute.description: Incoming traffic with this source (remote) port is selected by this Flow Policy.

attribute.name: dest
attribute.description: Incoming traffic with this destination (local) IP is selected by this Flow Policy.

attribute.name: soGrp
attribute.description: The socket group for this flow policy. The soGrp is used instead of a targetPool for certain protocols, for now only SCTP. soGrp and targetPool are mutually exclusive.

class.name: EvipProtocol
class.description: Container class for Port Ranges.

attribute.name: evipProtocolId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Defines the protocol for the cotained port ranges. Supported values are; "tcp" "udp" "sctp" "other" "all"

class.name: EvipPortRange
class.description: Defines a Port Range.

attribute.name: evipPortRangeId
attribute.description:
The RDN attribute. The port range. This must be a port range, for instance "1-32767".
Please see restrictions on allowed ranges in the EVIP Management Guide.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The range type. Must be "wellknown".

attribute.name: blocksize
attribute.description: OBSOLETE. Blocksize=64 (fixed value)

class.name: EvipSelectionPolicies
class.description: Container class for Selection policies.

attribute.name: evipSelectionPoliciesId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Always "1".

class.name: EvipSelectionPolicy
class.description: Defines a Selection Policy. Traffic selected by a Selection Policy in this ALB is directed to this ALB. Traffic selected by this Selection Policy must match all defined attributes (logical AND).

attribute.name: evipSelectionPolicyId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. The name must be unique.

attribute.name: process
attribute.description: Traffic to or from this process is selected by this Selection Policy.

attribute.name: dest
attribute.description: OBSOLETE (value ignored) Outgoing traffic with this (remote) address or subnet is selected by this Selection Policy.

attribute.name: destPort
attribute.description: OBSOLETE (value ignored) Outgoing traffic with this (remote) port is selected by this Selection Policy.

attribute.name: bindPort
attribute.description: OBSOLETE (value ignored) Incoming traffic to this port is selected by this selection policy. This attribute is only checked if an application makes a "bind" to the ANY address.

attribute.name: env
attribute.description: OBSOLETE (value ignored)

attribute.name: payloadNode
attribute.description: OBSOLETE (value ignored) A multivalue attribute that defines the payload nodes where this Selection Policy is applied.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: OBSOLETE (value ignored) The level 4 protocol. Supported values are; "tcp" "udp" "sctp" "other" "all"

attribute.name: alb
attribute.description: Traffic selected by this policy is directed towards this ALB.

attribute.name: sortorder
attribute.description: This must be a floating point number. The SelectionPolicies are ordered and are applied lowest->highest. This attribute defines the order. If more than one SelectionPolicy has the same value in this attribute the order is unspecified.

class.name: EvipSes
class.description: Container for se-objects

attribute.name: evipSesId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute. Always "1"

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed on all SEs when the containing ALB is activated. The commands are refered by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceeded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher.

class.name: EvipSe
class.description: IP-sec related

attribute.name: evipSeId
attribute.description: This is the RDN attribute. This must be an unique name within the alb.

attribute.name: commands
attribute.description: An array of commands that are executed the SE when the containing ALB is activated. The commands are refered by their identity specified in the EvipCommandDefinition. The commands are preceeded by a floating point order number and a colon, for example "1.0:defroute". The commands are executed in order lower to higher.

attribute.name: node
attribute.description: The node-id of the node where the SE is executing.

class.name: EvipXfrmSelectionPolicies
class.description: Container class for Xfrm Selection policies.

attribute.name: evipXfrmSelectionPoliciesId
attribute.description: RDN attribute, always "1".

class.name: EvipXfrmSelectionPolicy
class.description: Xfrm Alb selection policy. This is used to redirect XFRM (IPSec) configuration settings to a particular ALB (rather than the local Linux kernel). For further information please see the EVIP Management Guide.

attribute.name: evipXfrmSelectionPolicyId
attribute.description: The RDN attribute, must be a unique name.

attribute.name: payloadNode
attribute.description: Optional integer, denoting the payload node where this parameter is valid. If the eVIP configuration contains floating nodes, this parameter must be empty, and every XFRM ALB selection policy has an effect on every blade.

attribute.name: alb
attribute.description: The ALB that handles traffic selected by this policy.

attribute.name: process
attribute.description: The name of the process this policy maps to.

attribute.name: env
attribute.description: Set the EVIP_XALB environment variable to this value to use this policy.

attribute.name: order
attribute.description: The order of the selection policy as a floating point number. The selection plicy with lowest order is used if multiple policies match.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: If default=yes, this policy will apply to any process name and any value of EVIP_XALB. But selection policies with a lower order value can still override this policy.

attribute.name: local
attribute.description: OBSOLETE! Replaced by the "storage" attribute.

attribute.name: storage
attribute.description: How IPsec objects are stored. "local"=use local linux kernel "node"=accessible from inserter node only. Not supported on floating nodes. "alb"=accessible from whole ALB. Please see the EVIP Management Guide for more information.

class.name: EvipPortRanges
class.description: Container for port-ranges. The ranges are defined per protocol.

attribute.name: evipPortRangesId
attribute.description: The RDN, always "1"
